page.title: 17HOME LIFE
page.content: Communities are isolated, either grouped around farms or near an old manor house. The largest community is in Upper Upham. Home life in this area is ruled by motor transport. Daily routine includes taking the children to school, shopping and travelling to and from work. All visits to doctors, dentists, etc. have to be made by car. There is no public transport at all and only one main road crosses the area. A postal delivery is the only service available and a private telephone is extremely important. No gas is available so cooking and heating is fueled by other forms of energy (usually electricity or solid fuel). Entertainment in the home is usually via television, radio, video or books. Gardening is also an important form of recreation.
